properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 4:55AM PST until January 13 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVING IN TODAY...

.Our next weather system is moving in bringing heavy snow to the
mountains and valleys above 1500 ft. Breezy conditions, especially
on exposed ridges, will create areas of blowing snow which could
significantly reduce visibility. Plan on slippery road conditions
which will make travel difficult.

* WHAT...Snow expected for the Highway 2 corridor across the
Upper Columbia Basin. Total snow accumulations of up to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Grand Coulee, Wilbur, Creston, Almira and Hartline.

* WHEN...From 7 AM Sunday to 4 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions which will make
travel difficult. Breezy south winds could create blowing and
drifting snow in the afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY FOR THE HIGHWAY 2 CORRIDOR ACROSS THE UPPER COLUMBIA BASIN
